Articles.Content:
We all love space, we all love rockets and after a considerable amount of time we all know how to build a stable rocket by heart and send it in to space. If it were only that easy in real life. Yesterday night I watched this amazing documentary about the last space shuttle, the Atlantis. It's extremely impressive to see how many people are involved in the whole process towards the launch; from engineers to transport: this documentary gives you a great insight in how it's done. So next time you press space to launch, think about what you saw today... and be grateful all we have to do is pull up a dialog-box to load our craft in the blink of an eye.
